intro: Lobelia epilobioides var. luzonica, commonly known as Luzon's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
